main event: A graduate physicist observed eight circular objects moving in the sky near Columbus, Ohio on October 2, 1951.
interesting points: The observation lasted approximately 15 seconds,The objects were reported to be high speed and heading west,The source concluded that the objects were likely not weather balloons due to wind direction at the time,No sound was heard during the sighting,The original brightness and straight-line path of the objects led the observer to believe they were of a real origin.
sighted object: eight circular objects in the sky
witness description: graduate physicist from Battelle Memorial Institute
